number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2014
												To The Moon by Freebird games. This is such a great game. One of my favourites for sure. Don't watch the videos on YouTube, just play it. It might look basic/boring, but play it to the end and you will not be disappointed. I highly recommend playing it if you haven't already. [Overall rating 8.5/10]Gameplay is pretty average. There isn't much exciting about the gameplay. You click to move, search for objects, click objects, talk to NPCs and that is about it. Don't expect a lot from the gameplay but what it lacks here, it excels in storyline and audio. I believe the gameplay is meant to be quite simple so that more people can experience the story. Even though gameplay is a big deal in video games, this game was amazing still. [Gameplay rating 6/10]Storyline was something else. Beautiful. When you finish the game and reach the credits, you want to applaud... after you've wiped away the tears of course. If' you're just starting this game, I can't stress how important it is to play this game to the end just for that experience alone. The story alone makes up for the simple gameplay and graphics. [Story rating 10/10]Graphics are retro style, like something from a SNES time RPG. Don't expect something cutting-edge from the graphics, but they are detailed enough for you to see facial expressions and catch the emotions needed. [Graphics rating 8/10]Audio is amazing. I find that I'm listening to the full soundtrack regularly. The song, "Everythings Alright" by Laura Shigihara still gives me the feels when I hear it. Amazing voice, and amazing soundtrack. Audio often helps a great deal with infusing emotions into a story, this is definitely the case with To The Moon. [Audio rating 10/10]Instead of showing gameplay or epic moments in the game. I will leave you with a YouTube link for the full soundtrack. Enjoy.

												To The Moon is one of those games you instantly fall in love with. With it's simple, but elegant design, incredible writing, and thrilling, heartfelt tale. Beauty is a perfect word to describe it. The storytelling is masterful, and complex, and charming. The characters are lovable. You play as the two scientists who assist the man in the pursuit of his dream, and often act as the comic relief for emotionally tense situations. content:
7, 2014
												*sigh*What can I say about this game. Well, I expected more, I feel empty.The story is good, it keeps you interested enough to keep on playing. It has some really interesting and totally unexpected plot twists. The characters are likeable, you can get attached to them. It also has some awesome references that I'm pretty sure everyone loves. Music is also great.Now, there are some small mistakes like I wanted options in the game. On fullscreen the game was slightly to the left, resulting in a black area on the right, wanted to switch resolution to solve the problem. The game also a bit loud, being able to control the volume would be nice. Controls are a bit clunky.Other things I didn't like. There are some holes in the story, I feel there are parts that requires explanation, things that the game doesn't tell you, where I feel it's necessary. I also don't get emotionally attached to River and John, at least not much. I honestly do not believe that they loved eachother. River was cold all game not even caring about Johns feelings, and I think she is selfish, while I don't think John really loved River, looking at the not looking up the illness of River, the girl was just a person who is not like everyone else for John. Since I felt no real love between them, I couldn't really grew to them. The story itself is emotional, but mainly because of the two doctors.I built up emotions, I wanted to cry but I couldn't. I'm not attached to John and River, so I'm not really touched by their death, despite the fact that I'm insanely emotional and it's easy to get me crying.Anyhow, all in all, the story is not bad, if you can buy that the two of them loved eachother, you are going to enjoy it a lot more than I did. It's not a Professor Layton: Unwound Future(the story that touched me the most), but it worths that 4 hours it requires to play it through.

content:
3, 2013
Simply Amazing!TL;DR? Get this game! You will not regret its purchase especially at its price. For the five hours you will invest in the game, it will leave a mark on you forever!Pros:★ The story is one of the best I've ever experienced.★ Has a seamless feel to the game keeping you engaged.★ Cheap but definitely not nasty.★ The soundtrack is amazing and adds to the story.★ Left me crying like a little ♥♥♥♥♥.Cons:✖ Lack of any real 'gaming' may discourage some.✖ Left me crying like a little ♥♥♥♥♥.'To the Moon' would appear to start off like any other indie video game and may take a good five or ten minutes to understand on how it has been set out. But once you fall into the world of mystery that surrounds this game, you quickly become involved in a story that will leave an impressionable memory and have you wanting to reach for the story once again. Now if you are after action or involvement with a whole heap of WASD key bashing then this game does not suit that purpose. But if you are after a quiet evening and are ready to be involved in an amazing story then 'To the Moon' will be exactly what you are after.The only hiccup I have with this game is the puzzle sequence and found that it is Freebird's way of calling this a game. Whilst I do enjoy walking around talking to people and exploring the environment I found that the puzzle part wasn't exactly needed in the end development. Personally I love the piano and this game hits all of the perfect tones for the emotions it's trying to set. The music to this game plays a big part to each area you walk into and sets the mood very nicely. I don't want to give too much away as the mystery of the game is the gem in itself, but I promise you will find a connection to every single character that you find in the game.This is a game I know I will come back to in years time to come, just so I can listen to its story once again like any great book.

												This is one of the best games I've played in the longest time. Finally an RPG that focuses on the story. It's hard to say much without spoiling something, but I can say the characters were amazingly deep. I really could see this being turned into a movie. O_oThe game doesn't have much gameplay as a "game" most people are familiar with. It's more like a storybook, but once the ball gets rolling it was hard for me to stop watching. I was able to play this whole game in one sitting. Honestly not sure how long it took. I kinda lost track of time. I'm pretty sure I've been sitting here all day.I give this game:10/10 ★★★★★and two big thumbs up.

content:
ber 2, 2015
												This game has been in my library for quite some time, only when a friend recommended this that I started playing it one bored afternoon. I'm quite open to games but nonetheless I honestly thought this game was going to be boring after browsing through the store page. But seeing that it was recommended to me and that it's also got great reviews, I decided to start it. I didn't know what to expect, the game starts off a bit confusing as it's premise was very new to me, and I'm sure it  will be as well for some of you. What caught my attention and....emotions was the characters, their decisions, motivations and story. It all got me curious and I continued on wanting to learn more as I also got attached to them, some scenes are very heartwarming and sweet and others are innocent and depressing. The way the story is laid out in terms of memory links creates a very interesting and strong medium that makes it very easy to relate and observe the characters from. The game was never frustrating and you'll definitely find yourself pausing occasionally, if you're like me that enjoys a good soundtrack whilst revering the scenes and characters.This is certaintly a great game, if you are looking for a great story, short game with a great soundtrack, I'll also highly recommend this to you.

												This game has the BEST story of any game I've ever played. I read a lot of reviews about this game and all of them said that it had the saddest ending of any game ever. At first I was like pfffft yeah right and I was very hesitant to buy it. I randomly bought it yesterday and played through it in one sitting. It's about 4 hours long. Let me tell you this, this game has the saddest, most amazingly written story of any game I've played, any book I've read, or any movie I've seen. If you don't shed a tear by the time you've finished playing this game I refuse to believe you are a human being. The way that everything plays out and the soundtrack the accompany the setting go perfectly together. I know that 10 bucks seems like a little much for a 4 hour game but this is not just a game, it's an amazing piece of art that I think everyone can enjoy.

content:
y 30, 2014
												I played To The Moon after some heavy insistence of a friend of mine. At the first sights I felt attracted to its detailed scenarios although the cartoonish style of the characters were something of a drawback. However, the more I got into the story, and felt puzzled by it, the more that world seemed believable and the more its characters grew on my mind.Have you read a compelling book and felt the desperate urge to turn pages and pages because you HAD to know what was going to happen?  Playing To The Moon is like reading one of those books, there is a point in the story where you CAN'T turn back and you have to fulfill the quest.This is a game of mild exploration, mild puzzles and increasingly beauty in its storyline. I felt compelled to finish it just like first the time I play Max Payne, and although the story has nothing to do with revenge and bloody murder, the kind of urgency, of NEED to see what will happens, is the very same.Also, the game has some funny moments where you can't help but laughing hard (I did it and it was 2 A.M.!). Last but not least, To The Moon is graced with an a awesome soundtrack, it might be a bit repetitive, but all the songs fit perfectly in the right moments, not just being a background noise, but their piece of the stroy with their beauty.If you like playing games for their stories, then this is for you!

I can recommend this game 100 %, it's so fantastic - still shaking because of the this-game-was-extraordinarylylyly-good.

content:
8, 2014
												"In GameSpot's 2011 Game of the Year awards, To the Moon was given the "Best Story" award, which was won against Catherine, Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective, Portal 2, and Xenoblade Chronicles." Also, this game has Metascore rating of 81 which is pretty unusual for some indie pixel art.I've accidentally found this game in my collection, it was purchased in some bundle and became long forgotten. I decided to start it at least once to see what is it about and reduce number of unplayed games on my steam account.And it definitely wasn't a mistake. The game is a great story, presented in a clever way that keeps you interested for straight four hours. I won't lie - there isn't a lot of choice or freedom in this game, it is more of an interactive fiction that tells you about the entire lifetime of one person, so you could grant him a wish he couldn't get in his real life. You just sometimes press buttons to move to the next story point, but it is nicely told, gives you something to think about and with a plot twist. Everything we love about stories.And one more thing: there is no city, but there is a man. And there is a lighthouse.

content:
7, 2014
												*sigh*What can I say about this game. Well, I expected more, I feel empty.The story is good, it keeps you interested enough to keep on playing. It has some really interesting and totally unexpected plot twists. The characters are likeable, you can get attached to them. It also has some awesome references that I'm pretty sure everyone loves. Music is also great.Now, there are some small mistakes like I wanted options in the game. On fullscreen the game was slightly to the left, resulting in a black area on the right, wanted to switch resolution to solve the problem. The game also a bit loud, being able to control the volume would be nice. Controls are a bit clunky.Other things I didn't like. There are some holes in the story, I feel there are parts that requires explanation, things that the game doesn't tell you, where I feel it's necessary. I also don't get emotionally attached to River and John, at least not much. I honestly do not believe that they loved eachother. River was cold all game not even caring about Johns feelings, and I think she is selfish, while I don't think John really loved River, looking at the not looking up the illness of River, the girl was just a person who is not like everyone else for John. Since I felt no real love between them, I couldn't really grew to them. The story itself is emotional, but mainly because of the two doctors.I built up emotions, I wanted to cry but I couldn't. I'm not attached to John and River, so I'm not really touched by their death, despite the fact that I'm insanely emotional and it's easy to get me crying.Anyhow, all in all, the story is not bad, if you can buy that the two of them loved eachother, you are going to enjoy it a lot more than I did. It's not a Professor Layton: Unwound Future(the story that touched me the most), but it worths that 4 hours it requires to play it through.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
y 19, 2014
												Breathtakingly beautiful.I have just finished playing through To The Moon and I'm still shaken from the experience. I was in tears for a good 30 minutes. It's hard to describe why it affected me the way it did, just as it's hard to write a review/recommendation for this game.At it's core To The Moon is a very simplistic game. You walk around clicking the spacebar to find out about certain objects or to go through hours of dialogue that this game has to offer. That's it.However, this is some of the finest, best, most emotionally touching dialogue I've ever seen in any game, ever. The themes of death, love, loss, disease and inner battle are all addressed so well, it's actually quite surprising. It proves that video games stand on their own as a wonderful method of storytelling, because this story couldn't be told through another medium.As you can read on the Steam page it tells the story of two doctors trying to fulfill a dying man's wish. The pair travel backwards through his memories to see how they alter the future to make his dream come true... And that's all that can be said without spoilers.Unfortunately this means I'm going to have to leave this "recommendation" on a simple "trust me" basis.So, trust me, this is a game you want to experience.These are three hours of your time that will impact an touch you emotionally in a way you probably haven't experienced in a game before.And lastly, this game will really make you think about your life and your choices.There is no one I wouldn't recommend this game to. Even if I don't know you personally, I still want you to buy this game and let it affect you the way it affected me. Hope this convinced you to purchase and play through this brilliant story telling masterpiece.

Score: 95/100To call this "a game" would be (with the current state of gaming industry) an insult towards this piece of art.Most people who played the game loved it (and so did I). content:
4, 2014
												To The Moon by Freebird games. This is such a great game. One of my favourites for sure. Don't watch the videos on YouTube, just play it. It might look basic/boring, but play it to the end and you will not be disappointed. I highly recommend playing it if you haven't already. [Overall rating 8.5/10]Gameplay is pretty average. There isn't much exciting about the gameplay. You click to move, search for objects, click objects, talk to NPCs and that is about it. Don't expect a lot from the gameplay but what it lacks here, it excels in storyline and audio. I believe the gameplay is meant to be quite simple so that more people can experience the story. Even though gameplay is a big deal in video games, this game was amazing still. [Gameplay rating 6/10]Storyline was something else. Beautiful. When you finish the game and reach the credits, you want to applaud... after you've wiped away the tears of course. If' you're just starting this game, I can't stress how important it is to play this game to the end just for that experience alone. The story alone makes up for the simple gameplay and graphics. [Story rating 10/10]Graphics are retro style, like something from a SNES time RPG. Don't expect something cutting-edge from the graphics, but they are detailed enough for you to see facial expressions and catch the emotions needed. [Graphics rating 8/10]Audio is amazing. I find that I'm listening to the full soundtrack regularly. The song, "Everythings Alright" by Laura Shigihara still gives me the feels when I hear it. Amazing voice, and amazing soundtrack. Audio often helps a great deal with infusing emotions into a story, this is definitely the case with To The Moon. [Audio rating 10/10]Instead of showing gameplay or epic moments in the game. I will leave you with a YouTube link for the full soundtrack. Enjoy.

content:
, 2014
												The story of a man named "John Wyles" and a woman named "River" and a dream...a dream to go to the moon. There are three story acts in 'To The Moon': Act 1 will leave an empty feeling in your heart, Act 2 will answer questions left unanswered and Act 3 will drown your hearts in feelings and emotions that you otherwise were containing as you played. I can't spoil anything besides what is told from presentation here. There has only been a few "games" (well, this is an 'interactive story') out there which could, despite its graphics (it was made on an RPGMaker - it wasn't meant to be innovative; it was meant to be story-rich) which could touch the hearts of people, including me. Although I was not able to sit through this particular gem in one sitting (I can't feel for a game if noises are around me all the time, and thus only play this when it's quiet enough in the middle of the night...it is 5:22 AM as we are writing this and I've finished it.). I have to say that everyone, and I mean everyone, should see this work of fiction for themselves at least once as a gamer (or even just a bystander).9.5/10My overall feelings towards 'To The Moon'...my words do not justify this work enough and encourage anyone reading this to take the trip as I have. If I could, I would have cried sentimental tears.

												For the better part of two years now I've frequently been exposed to opinions that go something like this:"oh em gee, To The Moon is the saddest thing evurrrrr :("Being a naturally trusting person I assumed these people knew what they're talking about. I was somewhat worried going in and expected some sort of shattering experience. By the second half of Act1 I already found myself waiting for a plot twist of sufficient calibre to come by and salvage my expectations of tearjerkiness, but it never did. I am kinda disappointed. Yes, it's an interesting premise and a touching, excellent story but that's it. Although I'm confident it would make one hell of a Hollywood blockbuster if adapted, I found the whole thing barely more emotional than, say... Dear Esther. It's still a great, worthwhile experience, just... don't have particular expectations. Hype is bad mkay.

content:
er 24, 2016
												A short but heartwarming story.You play as two scientists who are tasked with fulfilling a dying man's wish by implanting him with artificial memories before he dies. He wishes to go to the moon, but he doesn't know why. You go back in time through his memories, from old man to young child, to find out why and to implant the new memory. Admittedly, the reason he wants to go to the moon is a bit ham-fisted, but the story surrounding his life is still quite touching and there are a few other interesting twists.The gameplay mostly consists of just walking around and interacting with people and objects, with a few easy puzzles in between (and an optional game of whack-a-mole for some reason). The gameplay is so minor that I'd honestly be fine if there were no interactivity at all, but it never gets in the way of the storytelling.If you like story-focused games (or even just these kinds of heart-tugging stories in general), l recommend To The Moon

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2013
												I really enjoyed this one. It's more of an interactive story than a game, but it's kind of brilliant how that perfectly fits the story. It's about memories that have already happened and you're meant to observe with minor input. It's charming all around and when everything ties together you'll ♥♥♥♥ bricks... or maybe cry if that's a thing you do.Now to the complaints! The concept is bold and it's a great accomplishment that it mostly works as a video game. But while the dialog itself has personality, there are parts of it I really dislike. All of the characters (children and elderly) speak at an 18 year old age level. It's supposed to take place in the future, but they use lots of contemporary nerdy video game and anime references. I like how they try to mix jokes in with the sadness, but the out of character meta jokes feel lame and take me out of it.So I'd recommend it to people who already like games and are looking for something story oriented, heartfelt, and different. I'd like to recommend it to people who are less in to games (because they'd easily be able to cope with the limited gameplay), but I think the in-jokes would be too off-putting for them to take the rest of it seriously.TL;DR - Memento + Inception + The Notebook. There's a 1 hour demo, so give it a try!

 This will hit you right in the feels....and you'll be glad it did. Don't be put off by the way this game starts, I was, and I beg you to learn from my mistake.After playing through the first 10 minutes or so i quickly declared the game to be "boring as hell" and "A magnificent waste of my time", but when I stumbled upon it in my library again late yesterday evening I gave it another shot....and played straight through the night just so I would get to finish it, hell I even played the minisodes while I was at it.I would highly recommend this game to anyone, it might not give you that adrenaline rush some people crave but it will sure as hell kick you right in the feels, and you'll thank it for doing so. During this game I laughed, I cried, and most of all I just had a ton of fun. The graphis aren't great, and yeah, sometimes the controls are a little wonky, but the AMAZING soundtrack won't leave you any time or need to worry about that. From some of the very first scenes to the very end, the music grabbed me and pulled me straight through the just as well written story. I would honestly tell everyone to buy this game, take a day off, and just play through it in one sitting. At the end, you'll almost be a different person. This game tells a wonderfull story, and does so in such a way that no matter what you wanted to happen, what you expected, what you hated, what you liked, you'll still love it, just the way it was.This game definitely got itself a place in my heart, and I hope it'll find it's way to your heart too.

content:
er 3, 2015
												Yes, this is a sad but thoughtful game. After playing it, I don't even know whether I should be happy or not. Perhaps makers of this game want this reaction. When I entered the house and hear the song 'For River', I can feel the sad inside it. When I finished the first time leap in the old man's memory and meet the old man behind the house, I can even feel his loneliness. He just stand there watching the light tower and maybe he was thinking the old time he spent with his wife. Then every time I leap the memory, I come closer to the truth why the old man wants to go to the moon, and in the last memory, when the old man was a child and went to the festival with his mom and brother, when he went to that cliff far from the noisy party, saw the stars and moon and finally met River, my tears went out, just an accident changed the old man's life. Because that accident his mom lost her mind, he also lost his brother, and the most important thing, he forget the first time he met River and the promise he made with her. River had mental illness but she tried her best to let Johnny remember her. The rabbit, the moon, the light tower, even that toy and bag, every thing was shown to Johnny but he still didn't remember anything. Though at last two doctors finally achieve the old man's dream, but we all know this is just a fake. The past cannot be changed, the story of Johnny and River is still there and two doc can still remember that sad story. And of course as the player I can also still remember their hard and sad life. Two poor patients finally leave this world, but their story won't leave this world. Ehh, I seldom write a article but this game deserve a long article. I strongly recommend everyone play this game and listen to the song 'For River', which full of Johnny's love to River. And at last, just like River said, 'I'm happy now, that's enough.' I hope everyone can find their own happiness through their lives, no matter how hard life is, just don't give up, do what you most want to do, just like River and Johnny.

content:
, 2014
												The story of a man named "John Wyles" and a woman named "River" and a dream...a dream to go to the moon. There are three story acts in 'To The Moon': Act 1 will leave an empty feeling in your heart, Act 2 will answer questions left unanswered and Act 3 will drown your hearts in feelings and emotions that you otherwise were containing as you played. I can't spoil anything besides what is told from presentation here. There has only been a few "games" (well, this is an 'interactive story') out there which could, despite its graphics (it was made on an RPGMaker - it wasn't meant to be innovative; it was meant to be story-rich) which could touch the hearts of people, including me. Although I was not able to sit through this particular gem in one sitting (I can't feel for a game if noises are around me all the time, and thus only play this when it's quiet enough in the middle of the night...it is 5:22 AM as we are writing this and I've finished it.). I have to say that everyone, and I mean everyone, should see this work of fiction for themselves at least once as a gamer (or even just a bystander).9.5/10My overall feelings towards 'To The Moon'...my words do not justify this work enough and encourage anyone reading this to take the trip as I have. If I could, I would have cried sentimental tears.

content:
er 17, 2016
												There are certain games that leaves a horrific scar, be it for bad or for worse; and there are games which leaves an emotional scar, making the experience sweeter and satisfying. Do not let the RPG Maker tag deceive you -- To The Moon isn't an RPG: if anything, it's on the far-end of the spectrum, simply because the game has no combat mechanics of that sort. Instead, it relies on something triple-A games sorely lack and aspire to achieve: a player-invested story built upon multiple layers. And the game wears it like a proud dogtag. What should be the focal point is always the story. About two "doctors" that help a man relieve his dreams again, eventually finding out the entire cause of it, and granting his wish of making it To The Moon. The game straddles the line between hope and despairity; loss and gain; tragedy and happiness -- all in under five hours (counting the 2 minisodes which are absolutely must-plays). To The Moon is an all-round experience that leaves you wanting more, and hopes that after you've gone through all the sobbing tissues right by your side, that you still have a bottle of scotch waiting for you once the game ends. Because trust me: you'll need it. Brilliant story, brilliant soundtrack -- To The Moon is one of the best gaming experiences of all-time.

content:
y 19, 2014
												Breathtakingly beautiful.I have just finished playing through To The Moon and I'm still shaken from the experience. I was in tears for a good 30 minutes. It's hard to describe why it affected me the way it did, just as it's hard to write a review/recommendation for this game.At it's core To The Moon is a very simplistic game. You walk around clicking the spacebar to find out about certain objects or to go through hours of dialogue that this game has to offer. That's it.However, this is some of the finest, best, most emotionally touching dialogue I've ever seen in any game, ever. The themes of death, love, loss, disease and inner battle are all addressed so well, it's actually quite surprising. It proves that video games stand on their own as a wonderful method of storytelling, because this story couldn't be told through another medium.As you can read on the Steam page it tells the story of two doctors trying to fulfill a dying man's wish. The pair travel backwards through his memories to see how they alter the future to make his dream come true... And that's all that can be said without spoilers.Unfortunately this means I'm going to have to leave this "recommendation" on a simple "trust me" basis.So, trust me, this is a game you want to experience.These are three hours of your time that will impact an touch you emotionally in a way you probably haven't experienced in a game before.And lastly, this game will really make you think about your life and your choices.There is no one I wouldn't recommend this game to. Even if I don't know you personally, I still want you to buy this game and let it affect you the way it affected me. Hope this convinced you to purchase and play through this brilliant story telling masterpiece.

At one point in the game, the player is required to walk across logs in order to proceed with the story. I got stuck behind a log, which rendered the entire 'level' unplayable. I ended up walking up the side of a lighthouse, off cliffs and then eventually entered the sky. I was forced to reload my save several times. Eventually I discovered that for this particular section of the game, it is better to resort to the keyboard controls instead.- Nice music, but somewhat repetitive in nature.

content:
er 28, 2016
												I've been meaning to get this game for a long time. Now I finally had a chance to actually play it, and I must say I regretted not getting it sooner. There was not a single thing I did not like about To The Moon. The story is well-written, the soundtrack is simply amazing, and the art is fitting. The mechanics could have been better but nothing that's stopping me from thoroughly enjoying the game.John's dying wish is to go to the moon, and the doctors, Eva and Niel, are contracted to fulfill it. To do it, they need to dive into John's memory to find out the cause of that desire. The story uncovers as you gradually dig deeper into John's past one stage at a time. This is a nice reminder that story progression doesn't necessarily means going forward.The puzzle pieces start to fit together as you go, and you get to know more about the characters, all of which are likeable in their own ways. Although, I find it funny that while the story is supposed to revolve around John, I feel like River is the most developed character throughout the story. I slowly started to understand why she acted the way she did, what she really wanted, how her mind worked, and I felt more sympathetic towards her than any other character. But while it's all dramatic and emotional, it is balanced by the constant comic relief mostly by the dialogue exchanges between Eva and Niel.The art isn't at all remarkable but it complements the atmosphere of the story very well and I probably won't have it any other way. Despite the rather low quality, they make up for it by using appropriate visual effects and color schemes. Even the subtle sprite movements, such as the eyes and arms, can show you what the characters are thinking or feeling during certain events. The soundtrack is, like I mentioned earlier, simply amazing. Even the simple piano piece that John wrote for River was very soothing and fun to listen to.Overall, I really enjoyed playing this game and I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a game with good story.

I feel the way the story is unfolded serves to greatly enhance the plot developments; To the Moon is one powerful story I don't think I'll ever forget.The one thing I'd like to note about the game is that it's primarily controlled with the mouse (although there are some sections that use the keyboard). Using the mouse for movement is unfamiliar and may feel weird at first, but after a few scenes you'll more than likely get used to it and thus it becomes a non-issue. One last thing I'd like to say is that if you do choose to delve into the fantastic story that is To the Moon, be sure you have something ready to wipe your eyes with nearby. When I saw how it ended I only cried for 20 minutes.

content:
8, 2014
												"In GameSpot's 2011 Game of the Year awards, To the Moon was given the "Best Story" award, which was won against Catherine, Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective, Portal 2, and Xenoblade Chronicles." Also, this game has Metascore rating of 81 which is pretty unusual for some indie pixel art.I've accidentally found this game in my collection, it was purchased in some bundle and became long forgotten. I decided to start it at least once to see what is it about and reduce number of unplayed games on my steam account.And it definitely wasn't a mistake. The game is a great story, presented in a clever way that keeps you interested for straight four hours. I won't lie - there isn't a lot of choice or freedom in this game, it is more of an interactive fiction that tells you about the entire lifetime of one person, so you could grant him a wish he couldn't get in his real life. You just sometimes press buttons to move to the next story point, but it is nicely told, gives you something to think about and with a plot twist. Everything we love about stories.And one more thing: there is no city, but there is a man. And there is a lighthouse.

												A heartwarming interactive storytelling game and an exceptional written story. It might just be one of the best game I've ever played. The soundtracks are phenomenal and really brings out the right emotions at the right time. One might think that the length of this game is a bit short (~4h), but it's actually just right and works out really well. I would suggest playing this game in one go.I truly believe that people who are not into the RPG pixel art style will be able to enjoy this game, as the main focus is not on the gameplay, but rather the story. I'm going to end this review without further explaining the details of the game. The reason being that explaining too much might ruin the experience and one's expectations distorted by others can itself be a spoiler.

er 22, 2014
												This was probably my favorite game ive played this year. It was brutally beautiful, like watching the first thirty minutes of Up backwards repeatedly - in a good way. Also, do not buy this without the soundtrack, which is equally gorgeous. Graphics and art style were very reminiscent of Chrono Trigger, though the controlls were a little clunky, like some of the other less well designed SNES titles, and the few puzzles were far too easy. But the story, art, and music's amazingness completely eclipsed anything that could be found wrong elsewhere. I was completely blown away. You must play this game, if only to watch your soul shed a few scars, and your heart become a little less cold.

content:
er 17, 2014
												I can't even begin to describe how brilliant this game is. I didn't really know what to expect going in, except that the game had gotten really good reviews, and that it was about going through a guy's memories. Turns out it's one of the best games I've ever played, and probably one of the most well-conceived and well-written indie games ever made. The way everything ties together as you work your way backwards through the memories is put together pretty much flawlessly. I couldn't find any discontinuity anywhere.The feels hit me harder than any form of media has since the show Chuck, and it's also genuinely hilarious at all the right moments. One of the characters in particular made me laugh out loud at his clever references and dialogue in pretty much every scene. I love how it's not so over-the-top funny that it comes off as trying too hard. It's just the perfect amount of humour.One piece of advice, I would recommend setting aside a good 5-6 hours and just playing the game straight through. The characters you play as are "pulling an all-nighter", and I feel that the game is best experienced in the same way - all at once. I took a break for a couple weeks part-way through, and when I came back, it took me a little while to remember what had happened.TL;DR: BUY. ABSOLUTELY WORTH $11.

6, 2015
												I stopped playing Mass Effect 3 for almost three months before I could finish it when I lost one of my favorite characters towards the end due to my own shortcomings. I leveled Cloud and friends for hours on end to try and keep her from dying (name held for spoiler protection) in FFVII. I replayed the same misison in Wing Commander II over and over to try and save Spirit. However sad I felt, it always was a game to me and never shed a tear. Not even close.Played To the Moon, and cried enough to rival that of my lifetime. Many may have missed the many many nuances of the story, and after completion I suggest reading up on it. This story takes reality by the feet and drags into the realm of Science Fiction. Every element, color choice, and dialogue is carefully placed to further the central focus of this game, the story. This emotional story/journey is the central focus (not gameplay, graphics, or gimmics) and is something so memorable. For me, I felt the tear jerking moment coming... but still caught me completely off guard. Excellent sound track. Bravo. Well done.Will play again when I actually man up and buy tissues.10/10

0, 2015
 This will hit you right in the feels....and you'll be glad it did. Don't be put off by the way this game starts, I was, and I beg you to learn from my mistake.After playing through the first 10 minutes or so i quickly declared the game to be "boring as hell" and "A magnificent waste of my time", but when I stumbled upon it in my library again late yesterday evening I gave it another shot....and played straight through the night just so I would get to finish it, hell I even played the minisodes while I was at it.I would highly recommend this game to anyone, it might not give you that adrenaline rush some people crave but it will sure as hell kick you right in the feels, and you'll thank it for doing so. During this game I laughed, I cried, and most of all I just had a ton of fun. The graphis aren't great, and yeah, sometimes the controls are a little wonky, but the AMAZING soundtrack won't leave you any time or need to worry about that. From some of the very first scenes to the very end, the music grabbed me and pulled me straight through the just as well written story. I would honestly tell everyone to buy this game, take a day off, and just play through it in one sitting. At the end, you'll almost be a different person. This game tells a wonderfull story, and does so in such a way that no matter what you wanted to happen, what you expected, what you hated, what you liked, you'll still love it, just the way it was.This game definitely got itself a place in my heart, and I hope it'll find it's way to your heart too.

ber 2, 2013
												A short, sweet (albeit a tad bit bitter) story of remaking a dying man's memories to give him peace before he dies. It's very funny (although Watt can be a ♥♥♥♥), and geniunely charming with some absolutely beautiful musical pieces. Controls are horribly counter intuitive though. You'll get stopped by terrain like flowers and such all the time. I'd only suggest this if you are someone who can get swept into the emotion of a story. If not, this "game that's not really a game" will probably wear on you very quickly.
